Package it.trvi.simpleicd10

Class ICD10CodesManipulator

java.lang.Object
it.trvi.simpleicd10.ICD10CodesManipulator
public class ICD10CodesManipulator
extends java.lang.Object
An object that contains the whole ICD-10 classification and that can thus provide information about the whole classification or about single codes.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    ICD10CodesManipulator()
    The constructor that reads the data from the xml file to load all the data relative to the ICD-10 classification.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String addDot​(java.lang.String code)
    Given an ICD-10 code, it returns the same code in the format with the dot.
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllCodes()
    It returns an ArrayList<String> that contains all the codes in the ICD-10 classification, ordered as in a depth-first pre-order visit.
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllCodes​(boolean withDots)
    It returns an ArrayList<String> that contains all the codes in the ICD-10 classification, ordered as in a depth-first pre-order visit.
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAncestors​(java.lang.String code)
    Given a String that contains an ICD-10 code, it returns the list of the ancestors of said code in the ICD-10 classification.
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getChildren​(java.lang.String code)
    Given a String that contains an ICD-10 code, it returns the list of the children of said code in the ICD-10 classification.
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getDescendants​(java.lang.String code)
    Given a String that contains an ICD-10 code, it returns the list of the descendants of said code in the ICD-10 classification.
    java.lang.String getDescription​(java.lang.String code)
    Given a String that contains an ICD-10 code, it returns the description of said code.
    int getIndex​(java.lang.String code)
    It returns the index of a particular code in the list returned by getAllCodes.
    java.lang.String getNearestCommonAncestor​(java.lang.String a, java.lang.String b)
    Given two ICD-10 codes a and b, it returns their nearest common ancestor in the ICD-10 classification (or an empty string if they don't have a nearest common ancestor).
    java.lang.String getParent​(java.lang.String code)
    Given a String that contains an ICD-10 code, it returns its parent in the ICD-10 classification (or an empty string if it doesn't have a parent).
    boolean isAncestor​(java.lang.String a, java.lang.String b)
    It checks whether a code (a) is one of the ancestors of another code (b).

    It checks whether a String is a valid block in ICD-10.

    It checks whether a String is a valid category in ICD-10.

    It checks whether a String is a valid category or subcategory in ICD-10.

    It checks whether a String is a valid chapter in ICD-10.

    It checks whether a String is a valid chapter or block in ICD-10.

    It checks whether a code (a) is one of the descendants of another code (b).

    Given a String that contains an ICD-10 code, it checks whether that code is a leaf in the ICD-10 classification.
    boolean isSubcategory​(java.lang.String code)
    It checks whether a String is a valid subcategory in ICD-10.
    boolean isValidItem​(java.lang.String code)
    It checks whether a String is a valid chapter, block, category or subcategory in ICD-10.
    java.lang.String removeDot​(java.lang.String code)
    Given an ICD-10 code, it returns the same code in the format without the dot.

    • isValidItem

      public boolean isValidItem​(java.lang.String code)
      It checks whether a String is a valid chapter, block, category or subcategory in ICD-10.
      Parameters:
      code - is the String that must be checked
      Returns:
      true if code is a valid ICD-10 code, otherwise false

    • getDescription

      public java.lang.String getDescription​(java.lang.String code) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Given a String that contains an ICD-10 code, it returns the description of said code.
      Parameters:
      code - is the ICD-10 code
      Returns:
      the description of code
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if code is not a valid ICD-10 code

    • getParent

      public java.lang.String getParent​(java.lang.String code) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Given a String that contains an ICD-10 code, it returns its parent in the ICD-10 classification (or an empty string if it doesn't have a parent).
      Parameters:
      code - is the ICD-10 code
      Returns:
      a String containing the parent of code (an empty string if code has no parent)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if code is not a valid ICD-10 code

    • getChildren

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getChildren​(java.lang.String code) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Given a String that contains an ICD-10 code, it returns the list of the children of said code in the ICD-10 classification.
      Parameters:
      code - is the ICD-10 code
      Returns:
      an ArrayList<String> containing all the children of code
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if code is not a valid ICD-10 code

    • isLeaf

      public boolean isLeaf​(java.lang.String code) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Given a String that contains an ICD-10 code, it checks whether that code is a leaf in the ICD-10 classification.
      Parameters:
      code - is the ICD-10 code
      Returns:
      true if code is a leaf in the ICD-10 classification (that is, if it has no children), false otherwise
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if code is not a valid ICD-10 code

    • getAncestors

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAncestors​(java.lang.String code) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Given a String that contains an ICD-10 code, it returns the list of the ancestors of said code in the ICD-10 classification.
      Parameters:
      code - is the ICD-10 code
      Returns:
      an ArrayList<String> containing all the ancestor of code, ordered from the closer to the furthest
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if code is not a valid ICD-10 code

    • getDescendants

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getDescendants​(java.lang.String code) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Given a String that contains an ICD-10 code, it returns the list of the descendants of said code in the ICD-10 classification.
      Parameters:
      code - is the ICD-10 code
      Returns:
      an ArrayList<String> containing all the descendants of code, ordered as in a depth-first pre-order visit
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if code is not a valid ICD-10 code

    • isAncestor

      public boolean isAncestor​(java.lang.String a, java.lang.String b) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      It checks whether a code (a) is one of the ancestors of another code (b). A code is never an ancestor of itself.
      Parameters:
      a - is the code that may or may not be an ancestor of b
      b - is the code that whose ancestors could include a
      Returns:
      true if a is one of the ancestors of b, false otherwise
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a or b are not a valid ICD-10 code

    • isDescendant

      public boolean isDescendant​(java.lang.String a, java.lang.String b) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      It checks whether a code (a) is one of the descendants of another code (b). A code is never a descendant of itself.
      Parameters:
      a - is the code that may or may not be a descendant of b
      b - is the code that whose descendants could include a
      Returns:
      true if a is one of the descendants of b, false otherwise
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a or b are not a valid ICD-10 code

    • getNearestCommonAncestor

      public java.lang.String getNearestCommonAncestor​(java.lang.String a, java.lang.String b) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Given two ICD-10 codes a and b, it returns their nearest common ancestor in the ICD-10 classification (or an empty string if they don't have a nearest common ancestor).
      Parameters:
      a - is an ICD-10 code
      b - is an ICD-10 code
      Returns:
      the nearest common ancestor of a and b if it exists, an empty string otherwise
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a or b are not a valid ICD-10 code

    • getAllCodes

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllCodes​(boolean withDots)
      It returns an ArrayList<String> that contains all the codes in the ICD-10 classification, ordered as in a depth-first pre-order visit.
      Parameters:
      withDots - is a boolean that controls whether the codes in the list that is returned are in the format with or without the dot.
      Returns:
      the list of all the codes in the ICD-10 classification, ordered as in a depth-first pre-order visit, in the format with the dot if withDots is true, in the format without the dot otherwise

    • getAllCodes

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllCodes()
      It returns an ArrayList<String> that contains all the codes in the ICD-10 classification, ordered as in a depth-first pre-order visit.
      Returns:
      the list of all the codes in the ICD-10 classification, ordered as in a depth-first pre-order visit, in the format with the dot

    • getIndex

      public int getIndex​(java.lang.String code) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      It returns the index of a particular code in the list returned by getAllCodes.
      Parameters:
      code - is the code whose index we want to find
      Returns:
      the index of code in the list returned by getAllCodes
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if code is not a valid ICD-10 code

    • removeDot

      public java.lang.String removeDot​(java.lang.String code) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Given an ICD-10 code, it returns the same code in the format without the dot.
      Parameters:
      code - is an ICD-10 code
      Returns:
      the same code in the format without the dot
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if code is not a valid ICD-10 code

    • addDot

      public java.lang.String addDot​(java.lang.String code) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Given an ICD-10 code, it returns the same code in the format with the dot.
      Parameters:
      code - is an ICD-10 code
      Returns:
      the same code in the format with the dot
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if code is not a valid ICD-10 code
